item.title: Interesting Results in Calculus
item.description: These are some useful results that are not easily found on the web.

item.title: Connectivity
item.description: The minimum number of elements (nodes or edges) that need to be removed to separate the remaining nodes into two or more isolated subgraphs.

item.title: Welcome to my digitial garden! ðŸª´ðŸŒ±
item.description: This page is where I keep my notes. The graph on the right shows a map of the interconnections between subjects I have written about.

item.title: Berry Phase
item.description: The general definition of the Berry phase is a phase angle (from 0 to 2\pi) that a complex vector acquires as it is transported through a path in its complex vector space.

item.title: Topological Quantum Chemistry
item.description: Ref: Bradlyn et.al, Nature, 20 Jul 2017 Question: Topological insulators represent only a few hundred of the 200,000 stoichiometric compounds.

item.title: Topological Obstructions
item.description: Ref: Topological Quantum Chemistry Wannier functions of a topologically trivial group of bands are smoothly continuous to an atomic limit, are exponentially localized, and transform under a band representation.

item.title: Wannier Functions
item.description: Wannier functions are the localized representation of the Bloch energy eigenstates of a periodic crystal.

item.title: Topological Obstructions
item.description: Ref: Topological Quantum Chemistry Wannier functions of a topologically trivial group of bands are smoothly continuous to an atomic limit, are exponentially localized, and transform under a band representation.

item.title: Topological Crystalline Insulators - Liang Fu
